verses.verse: (A Prayer <S%H8605><s%> of David.) Hear <S%H8085><s%> a just <S%H6664><s%> cause, <S%H6664><s%> O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> give <S%H7181><s%> heed <S%H7181><s%> to my cry; <S%H7440><s%> Give <S%H238><s%> ear <S%H238><s%> to my prayer, which is not from deceitful <S%H4820><s%> lips. <S%H8193><s%>
Let my judgment <S%H4941><s%> come <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> from Thy presence; <S%H6440><s%> Let Thine eyes <S%H5869><s%> look <S%H2372><s%> with equity. <S%H4339><s%>

Thou hast tried <S%H974><s%> my heart; <S%H3820><s%> Thou hast visited <S%H6485><s%> [me] by night; <S%H3915><s%> Thou hast tested <S%H6884><s%> me and dost find <S%H4672><s%> nothing; <S%H1077><s%> I have purposed <S%H2161><s%> that my mouth <S%H6310><s%> will not transgress. <S%H5674><s%>
As for the deeds <S%H6468><s%> of men, <S%H120><s%> by the word <S%H1697><s%> of Thy lips <S%H8193><s%> I have kept <S%H8104><s%> from the paths <S%H734><s%> of the violent. <S%H6530><s%>
My steps <S%H9036><s%> have held <S%H8551><s%> fast <S%H8551><s%> to Thy paths. <S%H4570><s%> My feet <S%H6471><s%> have not slipped. <S%H4131><s%>
I have called <S%H7121><s%> upon Thee, for Thou wilt answer <S%H6030><s%> me, O God; <S%H410><s%> Incline <S%H5186><s%> Thine ear <S%H241><s%> to me, hear <S%H8085><s%> my speech. <S%H565><s%>

Wondrously <S%H6395><s%> show <S%H6395><s%> Thy lovingkindness, <S%H2617><s%> O Savior <S%H3467><s%> of those who take <S%H2620><s%> refuge <S%H2620><s%> at Thy right <S%H3225><s%> hand <S%H3225><s%> From those who rise <S%H6965><s%> up [against them].
Keep <S%H8104><s%> me as the apple <S%H380><s%> of the eye; <S%H5869><s%> Hide <S%H5641><s%> me in the shadow <S%H6738><s%> of Thy wings, <S%H3671><s%>
From the wicked <S%H7563><s%> who despoil <S%H7703><s%> me, My deadly <S%H5315><s%> enemies, <S%H340><s%> who surround <S%H5362><s%> me.
They have closed <S%H5462><s%> their unfeeling <S%H2459><s%> [heart]; With their mouth <S%H6310><s%> they speak <S%H1696><s%> proudly. <S%H1348><s%>

They have now <S%H6258><s%> surrounded <S%H5437><s%> us in our steps; <S%H838><s%> They set <S%H7896><s%> their eyes <S%H5869><s%> to cast <S%H5186><s%> [us] down <S%H5186><s%> to the ground. <S%H776><s%>

He is like <S%H1825><s%> a lion <S%H9030><s%> that is eager <S%H3700><s%> to tear, <S%H2963><s%> And as a young <S%H3715><s%> lion <S%H3715><s%> lurking <S%H3427><s%> in hiding <S%H4565><s%> places. <S%H4565><s%>

Arise, <S%H6965><s%> O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> confront <S%H6923><s%> him, bring <S%H3766><s%> him low; <S%H3766><s%> Deliver <S%H6403><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> from the wicked <S%H7563><s%> with Thy sword, <S%H2719><s%>

From men <S%H4962><s%> with Thy hand, <S%H3027><s%> O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> From men <S%H4962><s%> of the world, <S%H2465><s%> whose portion <S%H2506><s%> is in [this] life; <S%H9132><s%> And whose belly <S%H990><s%> Thou dost fill <S%H4390><s%> with Thy treasure; <S%H6840><s%> They are satisfied <S%H7646><s%> with children, <S%H1121><s%> And leave <S%H5117><s%> their abundance <S%H3499><s%> to their babes. <S%H5768><s%>
As for me, I shall behold <S%H2372><s%> Thy face <S%H6440><s%> in righteousness; <S%H6664><s%> I will be satisfied <S%H7646><s%> with Thy likeness <S%H8544><s%> when I awake. <S%H9516><s%>
